column4: grub-pc is being updated, and its asking me where I want to install it
i have linux on /dev/sda6, windows on /dev/sda
where do I install grub to
You can install it to the mbr or the first boot sector or sda
Oh wait. You have windows on sda... you have to install to mbr
There are 3 choices, sda, which is windows, sda6 which is my linux partition, and another one is my flash drive obviously thats not the right one
so im guessing i just select sda6
and that will still allow me to access windows
Go for it. I'm surprised there's not an option for the mbr
you sure this wont mess anything up?
I've always installed to either mbr or first boot sector... I have no idea
I am very hesistant to do this if youre not sure
I am upgrading to Ubuntu 10.04 from an older version, so I already had Grub installed
however, my nvidia module apparently didndt work, so i have a low graphics desktop right now
I'd install to sda. It's your mbr. From there grub will allow your to boot from sda6 or chainload to windows
However, you may need to edit /boot/menu.lst to point it to sda1. Usually, it's detect automatically though.
